bib.title: Photonuclear Data. Photodisintegration Of Lithium. Evaluated Cross Sections Of Channels And Reactions.

free_txt: Review.
Corrected by V.Varlamov, V.Mclane.
Corrected by V.Varlamov: SF7 in SUBENT 11
reaction  deleted,  E  defined under EN-sec,  SF7 in
SUBENT  12  reaction  deleted,  E1-MIN  and   E2-MIN
defined under EN-SEC.
Corrected by SD and VV:  Updated  to  new
date formats, lower case, STATUS, EN-SEC in SUBENT
The statistical evaluation was used.
The main  criteria  used  was   similarity   of   the
generalized features of initial cross sections, such
as integrated cross sections and centers of gravity,
to  their  weighted-mean values.  The main principle
used  for  analyzing  and  reducing  of   systematic
discrepancies   between  the  results  of  different
experiments      was       some       transformation
(recalibration-correction  of  the  scale in  energy
axis,  renormalization-correction of  the  scale  in
cross  section  axis) of initial cross sections with
that  aim  of  forming   the   best   agreement   of
generalized characteristics.
Initial cross     sections     whose      generalized
characteristics   were   too   different   from  the
weightedmean values (the systematic errors were  too
high)  were  rejected  and  the entire procedure was
repeated.
The set  of  cross section values that have satisfied
all the selection criteria, was used to evaluate the
cross   sections   and  their  errors  by  means  of
reduction method.  The main principles used  in  the
analysis,  aimed  at  finding out the role of one or
another channels in the nuclear  photodisintegration
processes  within  definite  energy ranges,  were as
follows.
To determine the kinematic conditions for emission of
particles of various types allowance was made for:
- reaction thresholds;
- thresholds of particle detection;
- particle energy spectra;
the photonuclear reaction data were specified wrong:
- experimental partial cross sections;
- angular distributions of the reaction products;
- cross sections of inverse reactions of radiative
capture.
Certain theoretical  concepts  were  used to evaluate
the     relative      contributions      to      the
photodisintegration    cross   sections   from   the
processes of emission of particles of various types:
- the   relation  of  the  (gamma,p)  and  (gamma,n)
channels in self-conjugate nuclei;
- the relation of various deuteron channels.
The agreement of the sums of partial  cross  sections
with  the  total  cross  sections  was controlled by
chi**2.
Root-mean-square errors.
By V.V.Varlamov.
Statistical  evaluation of the data from independent
measurements.
Used for Eg < 15 MeV.
Used for Eg-bin 1 MeV.
Recalculated by reduction method.
Data presented in Fig. on page 27.
(g,n0) cross  section  was  recalculated   from  the
total  cross  section.  The  main criterion  was the
agreement  between  the  sum sig(g,p0) + sig(g,p1) +
sig(g,n0) + sig(g,n1) + sig(g,n+p) and  sig(gamma,xn)
for Eg <= 26 MeV.
The agreement was controlled using criterion chi**2.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 28.
(g,n1)  cross  section  was  recalculated  from the
(g,p1) cross  section. The main criterion  was  the
agreement between  the sum   sig(g,p0) +  sig(g,p1)
+ sig(g,n0) + sig(g,n1) + sig(g,n+p) and  sig(g,xn)
for Eg <= 26 MeV
The agreement was controlled using criterion chi**2.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 29.
For Eg < 26 MeV the statistical evaluation was used.
For Eg  > 35 MeV evaluated cross section was obtained
as sum sig(g,yp)=sig(g,p-0) + sig(g,p-1) + sig(g,n+p)
+ sig(g,p+d+t) + sig(g,2n+p+3He) + sig(g,2p+n+t).
Used below Eg-max = 26.9 MeV.
Used below Eg-max = 27 MeV.
Used below Eg-max = 30 MeV.
Used below Eg-max = 35 MeV.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 31.
For Eg < 10 MeV evaluated cross section was obtained as
interpolation of data of Berman and Makhnovskij.
For Eg = 10 - 17 MeV the data of Makhnovskij were used
For Eg > 17 MeV  the total cross section was calculated
from  differential  cross section of Denisov. The main
criterium-agreement of the sum  sig(g,p-0) + sig(g,p-1
+ sig(g,n-0) + sig(g,n-1) + sig(g,n+p) with evaluated
sig(gamma,xn).
The agreement was controlled using criterion chi**2.
Eg-max = 20 MeV.
Difference spectra method.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 33.
For  Eg  <  22 MeV  sig(g,p-1) was  evaluated  on the
basis  of  the  best  agreement  between   the   sum
sig(g,n0)+sig(g,n1)    +   sig(g,p0)   +
sig(g,p1) + sig(g,p+n) and sig(g,xn) and
sig(g,xp).
The  data  of  photoproton energy spectra of Bazhanov
were  used.
The  agreement was controlled using criterion chi**2.
Used difference spectra method.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 38.
Sig(g,n+p) was  evaluated  on the basis  of the best
agreement between the sum  sig(g,n0) + sig(g,n1)  +
sig(g,p0) +  sig(g,p1)  + sig(g,n+p) and  sig(g,xp)
and sig(g,xn).
The agreement was controlled wrong criterion chi**2.
For E(alpha)    >   5   MeV   sig(gamma,x+alpha)   =
sig(gamma,n+p+alpha)  differential   cross   section
multiplied 4pi was used.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 35.
For Eg < 30 MeV the statistical evaluation was used.
For Eg = 30 - 44 MeV the evaluated cross section  was
obtained  from  sig(g,p+d)  of  Denisov,  normalized
by means of integrated cross  section  data  to  the
cross sections of Murakami and Kotikov.
For Eg > 44 MeV  evaluated cross section was obtained
by   means  of  interpolation   to  mean  value   of
differential cross section of Volkov,  multiplied by
4pi.
Renormalized to evaluation integral cross section of
the Li-6(g,t)He-3 reaction.
Calculated from   data   renormalized  to  evaluated
integrated  cross   section  of  (g,p+d+t)  reaction
at Eg = 33 - 44 MeV.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 37.
For Eg  < 30 the evaluated cross section was obtained
from Berman data by reduction method.
For Eg > 30  MeV  the  evaluated  cross  section  was
obtained as a difference sig(g,2n+p) = sig(g,x+He3)-
sig(g,t+He3) - sig(g,n+d+He3),  where sig(g,n+d+He3)
was recalculated from sig(g,p+d+t) of Denisov.
Deuteron energy E-min = 5 MeV.
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 39.
Sig(g,2n+2p) was obtained as  difference  between
sig(g,x+d)    of    Denisov    and    the    sum
sig(g,p+d+t) + sig(g,n+d+He3).
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 40.
For Eg < 32 MeV evaluated cross section was  obtained
as sig(g,n+2p+t) = sig(g,x+n) - sig(g,n+d+He3) -
2sig(g,2n+p+He3).
For Eg  > 32 MeV evaluated cross section was obtained
as a difference sig(g,n+2p+t) = sig(g,xn)  -
sig(g,abs) - sig(g,2n+p+He3) - sig(g,2n+2p+d).
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 41.
The statistical evaluation was used.
Differential cross  sections  were  recalculated  in
accordance   with   angular   distribution  data  of
Junghans.
Eg-max =  31  MeV,  E-min = 5 MeV,  used for Eg < 25
MeV.
Eg-max = 35 MeV.
Eg-max = 90 MeV, used for Eg < 22.5 MeV.
Eg-max = 103 MeV.
Recalculated from the differential cross section of
the inverse reaction.
Recalculated from the differential cross section  of
the inverse reaction used for Eg = 20 MeV.
Recalculated from  the differential cross section of
the inverse reaction.

Data presented in Fig. on page 43.
The evaluated  cross  section  for   the   low-energy
photoabsorption  component  was  obtained  as  a sum
sig(g,abs) = sig(g,p0)  +  sig(g,p1)  +  sig(g,n0) +
sig(g,n1) + sig(g,n+p).
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 44.
The evaluated   cross  section  for  the  high-energy
photoabsorption component  was  obtained  as  a  sum
sig(g,abs-He) =  sig(g,n+2p+t)  +  sig(g,2n+p+He3) +
sig(g,t+He3)  +   sig(g,p+d+t)  +  sig(g,n+d+He3)  +
sig(g,2n+2p+d) + sig(g,3n+3p).
Data received from author.
Data presented in Fig. on page 45.
The evaluated   photoabsorption   cross  section  was
obtained as a  sum  of  low-energy  and  high-energy
component cross sections.
